channel.title: Finding Deduplication on DefectDojo Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Finding Deduplication on DefectDojo Documentation

item.title: About Deduplication
item.description: DefectDojo is designed to ingest bulk reports from tools, creating one or more Findings based on the content of the report. When using DefectDojo, you’ll most likely be ingesting reports from the same tool on a regular basis, which means that duplicate Findings are highly likely.

item.title: Enabling Deduplication
item.description:
Deduplication can be implemented at either a Product level or at a more narrow Engagement level.

Deduplication for Products

  1. Start by navigating to the System Settings page. This is nested under Settings > Pro Settings > ⚙️ System Settings on the sidebar.

item.title: Deduplication Algorithms
item.description:
Overview

DefectDojo supports four deduplication algorithms that can be selected per parser (test type):

  • Unique ID From Tool: Uses the scanner-provided unique identifier.
  • Hash Code: Uses a configured set of fields to compute a hash.
  • Unique ID From Tool or Hash Code: Prefer the tool’s unique ID; fall back to hash when no matching unique ID is found.
  • Legacy: Historical algorithm with multiple conditions; only available in the Open Source version.

Algorithm selection per parser is controlled by DEDUPLICATION_ALGORITHM_PER_PARSER (see the Open-Source tuning page for configuration details).

item.title: Delete Deduplicate Findings
item.description: If you have an excessive amount of duplicate Findings which you want to delete, you can set Delete Deduplicate Findings as an option in the System Settings.

item.title: Avoid Duplicates: Reimport Recurring Tests
item.description: If you have a CI/CD pipeline, a daily scan process or any kind of repeated incoming report, setting up a Reimport process in advance is key to avoiding excessive duplicates. Reimport collapses the context and Findings associated with a recurring test into a single Test page, where you can review import history and track vulnerability changes across scans.

item.title: Deduplication Tuning (Pro)
item.description: Deduplication Tuning is a DefectDojo Pro feature that gives you fine-grained control over how findings are deduplicated, allowing you to optimize duplicate detection for your specific security testing workflow.

item.title: Deduplication Tuning (Open Source)
item.description: This page explains how to tune deduplication in the Open Source (OS) edition of DefectDojo. For a visual, feature-rich tuning UI, see the Pro documentation. The OS edition uses settings files and environment variables.
